properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing quarter-sized hail and damaging winds in excess of 90 km/h. At 4:54 PM CST Doppler RADAR indicated that this severe thunderstorm was located about 10 km west of Shellbrook and was moving toward the east at 30 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2019-07-15T01:53:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T22:55:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1785848054.2019
Area: R.M. of Canwood including Debden and Big River Res., R.M. of Leask including Leask Mistawasis Res. and Parkside, R.M. of Shellbrook including Sturgeon Lake Res., R.M. of Duck Lake including Duck Lake and Beardy's Res.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-15T04:59:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T23:25:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2200958738.2019
Area: Sussex - Kennebecasis Valley and Kings County, Saint John and County, Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick, Fundy National Park

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke from wildfire activity is causing locally reduced visibilities and poor air quality. ### For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:46 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing torrential rain. A line of thunderstorms stretching from Hampton to Pomery has become quasi-stationary. Localised heavy rainfall could create local flooding. Hail is also possible from these thunderstorms. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:31 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is located near Bircham and is moving to the east at 40 km/h. This thunderstorm has a history of producing tornadoes. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-15T00:30:40-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:02 p.m. ADT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts and torrential rain. Clusters of thunderstorms over the area will likely give heavy rainfall, strong winds and hail. These thunderstorms are expected to weaken over the next hour. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-15T02:00:52-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Showers and thunderstorms have developed. Thunderstorms have weakened significantly in the last hour however the potential exists for severe thunderstorms to redevelop this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-15T09:00:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T23:07:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0709919131.2019
Area: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms over Manitoba are expected to move into the area this evening and may become severe. Severe thunderstorms are also possible through the night into early Monday. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-15T11:00:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T23:01:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1479069667.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots. Strong to severe thunderstorms are expected to develop over Lake Manitoba this evening which will persist into the overnight hours. Similar thunderstorms are likely over the south basin of Lake Winnipeg overnight and into Monday morning. Wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected in some of these thunderstorms. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-07-15T15:22:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T23:23:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0390918802.2019
